subject: Testing a method with no return value
msgSnippet: First, please choose a subject line that better reveals your question. Everyone here needs help. ... With the method you have there, there is no point in
messageBody:
First, please choose a subject line that better reveals your question.
Everyone here needs help.

santu nand wrote:

> can anyone tell me how to test a a public datamember which returns
> nothing and its all acting upon private data members only.
>
> For ex:
>
> class sample
>
> {
>
> private int x;
>
> public void change()
>
> {
>
> x=10;
>
> }
>
> }
>
> Now is it possible to test this change method???

With the method you have there, there is no point in testing it, because
/nothing/ uses the value of x. In this case, don't test it.

Of course, in your /real/ class, something somewhere uses the value of
that field to do some kind of calculation. Presumably that calculation
has a different result depending on the value of that field. The result
of that calculation, then, tells you whether the field has the correct
value.

Please see _JUnit Recipes_, recipe 2.2.
--
